entity.name: `popover` attribute (Popover API)
entity.description: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionHtml: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.
entity.descriptionClean: HTML syntax and JS API facilitating popovers such as overlays, popups, menus etc.

example.code: Popover content
example.codeHighlighted: <button popovertarget="foo">Toggle the popover</button> <div id="foo" popover>Popover content</div>

resources.title: The Popover API (previously Popup) · Issue #743 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: The popover HTML attribute creates an overlay to display content on top of other page content. Popovers can be shown declaratively using HTML, or using the showPopover() method.
webFeature.name: Popover

entity.name: `<dialog>`
entity.description: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionHtml: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
entity.descriptionClean: Creates a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.

example.code:
<dialog id="confirm">
	<form method="dialog">
		Are you sure?
		<button value="1">Yes</button>
		<button value="0">No</button>
	</form>
</dialog>
example.codeHighlighted: <dialog id="confirm"> <form method="dialog"> Are you sure? <button value="1">Yes</button> <button value="0">No</button> </form> </dialog>

webFeature.description_html: The <dialog> HTML element represents a modal or non-modal dialog box, such as a confirmation prompt or a subwindow used to enter data.
webFeature.name: <dialog>

entity.name: Reliance on JavaScript
entity.description: Excessive reliance on JavaScript
entity.descriptionHtml: Excessive reliance on JavaScript
entity.descriptionClean: Excessive reliance on JavaScript

entity.name: DOM APIs
entity.description: Issues related to core DOM manipulation APIs, including issues around creating, updating, or removing DOM nodes via JavaScript APIs.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues related to core DOM manipulation APIs, including issues around creating, updating, or removing DOM nodes via JavaScript APIs.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to core DOM manipulation APIs, including issues around creating, updating, or removing DOM nodes via JavaScript APIs.

entity.name: HTML Reuse
entity.description: Pain points related to reusing and modularizing HTML content.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points related to reusing and modularizing HTML content.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points related to reusing and modularizing HTML content.

entity.name: Templating
entity.description: Lack of templating
entity.descriptionHtml: Lack of templating
entity.descriptionClean: Lack of templating

entity.name: Declarative APIs
entity.description: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with `limitations`), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with `ergonomics`).
entity.descriptionHtml: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with limitations), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with ergonomics).
entity.descriptionClean: Complaints about lack of declarative APIs (combine with limitations), or current declarative APIs (as a whole) being hard to use (combine with ergonomics).

entity.description: The lack of native access to WebSockets, Server Sent Events, and other features supported by htmx directly in HTML.
entity.descriptionHtml: The lack of native access to WebSockets, Server Sent Events, and other features supported by htmx directly in HTML.
entity.descriptionClean: The lack of native access to WebSockets, Server Sent Events, and other features supported by htmx directly in HTML.

entity.name: Partial Page Updates
entity.description: The desire for a native mechanism to update parts of a page with HTML from a server response, without a full page reload, similar to what libraries like htmx or Turbo provide.
entity.descriptionHtml: The desire for a native mechanism to update parts of a page with HTML from a server response, without a full page reload, similar to what libraries like htmx or Turbo provide.
entity.descriptionClean: The desire for a native mechanism to update parts of a page with HTML from a server response, without a full page reload, similar to what libraries like htmx or Turbo provide.

entity.name: `<details>` and `<summary>`
entity.description: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionHtml: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.
entity.descriptionClean: A disclosure widget that can be toggled to hide or show content interactively.

example.codeHighlighted: <details> <summary>Details</summary> Longer content </details>

webFeature.description_html: The <details> element is a disclosure widget which can be expanded to reveal additional content. When closed, only the nested <summary> element is visible.
webFeature.name: <details>

entity.name: Reactivity
entity.description: Issues with reactivity
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues with reactivity
entity.descriptionClean: Issues with reactivity

entity.name: Data Binding
entity.description: Pain points around the lack of a native way to bind JavaScript data to DOM elements, so that changes in one are automatically reflected in the other.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points around the lack of a native way to bind JavaScript data to DOM elements, so that changes in one are automatically reflected in the other.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points around the lack of a native way to bind JavaScript data to DOM elements, so that changes in one are automatically reflected in the other.

entity.name: Signals
entity.description: Desire for a native implementation of the Signals pattern for fine-grained reactivity.
entity.descriptionHtml: Desire for a native implementation of the Signals pattern for fine-grained reactivity.
entity.descriptionClean: Desire for a native implementation of the Signals pattern for fine-grained reactivity.

entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to using Accessible Rich Internet Applications (ARIA) attributes and patterns.

resources.title: Tether elements to each other with CSS anchor positioning

webFeature.description_html: Anchor positioning places an element based on the position of another element. For example, you can place a tooltip next to the content it references.
webFeature.name: Anchor positioning

entity.name: Top Layer
entity.description: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like <dialog> and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like  and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.
entity.descriptionClean: Issues related to the top layer, where elements like  and popovers are rendered. Includes z-index conflicts, stacking order control, and interactions between multiple top-layer elements.

entity.name: Missing elements
entity.description: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.
entity.descriptionHtml: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.
entity.descriptionClean: The need to build common UI patterns from scratch due to the lack of built-in, accessible HTML elements.

entity.name: Tabs element
entity.description: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.
entity.descriptionHtml: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.
entity.descriptionClean: Pain points from the lack of a native HTML element for tabbed interfaces, a common UI pattern.

entity.name: `<details name>` (Exclusive Accordion)
entity.description: Group `<details>` elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.
entity.descriptionHtml: Group <details> elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.
entity.descriptionClean: Group <details> elements so that only up to one in the group can be open at a time.

example.code:
<details open name="sidebar_panel">
	<summary>Main info</summary>
	<!-- controls -->
</details>
<details name="sidebar_panel">
	<summary>Style</summary>
	<!-- controls -->
</details>
example.codeHighlighted: <details open name="sidebar_panel"> <summary>Main info</summary> <!-- controls --> </details> <details name="sidebar_panel"> <summary>Style</summary> <!-- controls --> </details>

resources.title: Add name attribute for grouping details elements into an exclusive accordion by dbaron · Pull Request #9400 · whatwg/html · GitHub
Exclusive accordion (<details name="">) · Issue #866 · w3ctag/design-reviews · GitHub

webFeature.description_html: Multiple <details> elements which use the same name attribute are mutually exclusive. When one member of the group is opened, all other members are closed.
webFeature.name: Mutually exclusive <details> elements
